str2: Wherefore, on which account, therefore. From dia and hos; through which thing, i.e. Consequently.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To go in, come in, enter. From eis and erchomai; to enter.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably from the base of komizo; orderly arrangement, i.e. Decoration; by implication, the world (morally).

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Abstr. and concr: sacrifice; a sacrifice, offering. From thuo; sacrifice.
An offering, sacrifice. From prosphero; presentation; concretely, an oblation or sacrifice.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To will, wish, desire, be willing, intend, design.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Body, flesh; the body of the Church. From sozo; the body, used in a very wide application, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From kata and a derivative of artios; to complete thoroughly, i.e. Repair or adjust.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
